name: media.diarize_audio
description: Perform speaker diarisation on an audio or video file using pyannote-audio, returning timestamped speaker turns. Optionally merge with a Whisper transcript to produce speaker-attributed segments.

audio_path.description: Path to an audio or video file (any format readable by ffmpeg).

model.description: Pyannote pipeline name. Use 'pyannote/speaker-diarization-community-1' (free, local) or 'pyannote/speaker-diarization-precision-2' (cloud API).

token.description: HuggingFace token (for community models) or pyannoteAI API key (for precision models). Falls back to HF_TOKEN or PYANNOTE_API_KEY environment variables.

num_speakers.description: Exact number of speakers if known.

device.description: PyTorch device for local models (e.g., 'cuda', 'cpu', 'mps'). Auto-detected if null. Ignored for cloud models.

output_dir.description: Directory for output files. Defaults to ./<audio_stem>_diarization.

transcript_json.description: Optional path to a transcript.verbose.json from media.analyze_video. When provided, output includes speaker-attributed transcript segments and SRT.

diarization_json.description: Path to diarization.json containing full turns and speaker list.

diarized_transcript_json.description: Path to transcript.diarized.json with speaker-attributed segments. Null if transcript_json was not provided.

diarized_srt.description: Path to transcript.diarized.srt with speaker prefixes. Null if transcript_json was not provided.

errors.description: Diarisation failed (missing pyannote-audio, invalid token, audio unreadable, etc.).

side_effects: Downloads pyannote model weights on first use (community models). Cloud models send audio to pyannoteAI servers. Writes output files to output_dir.
